results.title: The Trout
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”
Trout in the southern regions of Britain live in the gently flowing chalk rivers, finding plenty of food in the weeds and insects, so they must be tempted with the dry fly. We watch the angler waiting for the trout to rise after flies drifting downstream, then casting into a river in Berkshire. Underwater photography shows the fish - and the strike!
results.description:

results.title: The Tench
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”
One of a series of films on inland water fishing in England introduced by Bernard Venables. On a soft late-summer day we go float fishing for tench on the Bridgewater Canal in Somerset. The behaviour of the fish and bait are seen in close up, a strike is shown and the fish is caught.

results.title: The Salmon
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”.
A summary of the salmon’s birth, run to the sea, and return, after a year or more to the river of its birth, is given, and we see the various stages described with underwater photography. A local angler shows the technique of catching the salmon by the fly fishing method in a river in Westmoreland.

results.title: The Pike
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”.
One of a series of films on inland water fishing in England, introduced by Bernard Venables. It is March and Venables demonstrates spinning for pike with some success on the River Avon in Hampshire, and afterwards debates his methods with Ken Baker.
results.description:

results.title: Myths of nationalism
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Towards the end of the 19th century, there was, in Europe, a second wave of industrialisation with a more advanced technology. This considers each of the major powers within Europe in relation to this new technology, in the years leading up to the Great War of 1914-18.

results.title: An Age of revolutions
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
A survey of the impact of the French Revolution from 1789, through the 1838, 1848 revolutions to the Paris Commune of 1871.

results.title: The Middle Ages
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
History of the Middle Ages from Charlemagne examined through art, monasteries, agriculture and invasions. Illustrated by 15th century miniatures, the film gives a good background to European history, literature and art.

results.title: Towards a modern Europe: the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Explains and illustrates the transition from the Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including the principles of the new study and attitudes in art, architecture and scholarship
